website_summaries.verdict: These zippy electric heel wheels are perfect for adrenaline junkies or as a step up for accomplished riders seeking more speed.
pros: Boasts an 80 watt geared-drive motor that automatically starts up when rolling
Rechargeable 12-volt lithium ion battery runs for up to 30 minutes of non-stop use
Holds up to 176 pounds Quality construction
cons: Might be too fast for smaller kids

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 rides
customer_reviews.text: I rarely review a product but felt this was a must buyer beware. Skates were bought for athletic 10 year old girl size 4 sneaker. 1. Difficult to put on with high tops 2. Should only be used on sport court surface or tennis courts. Pavement destroyed skate surface and wore down wheels. 3. After 5 rides plastic adjustment snapped and skates are now useless. Buy your kid a regular set of inline skates. Wear better and provide more exercise!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn from Long Island

customer_reviews.title: Not Very Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Fully charged, they hardly have power. My son can only ride them in our drive way. These do not work on black top like the street. Kinda bummed.
customer_reviews.author: M&T

customer_reviews.title: ... the skate with no motor it would be more easy to balance
customer_reviews.text: The Skate should of had a third wheel optional on the skate with no motor it would be more easy to balance.It would have gave it a rocket skate effect. there to hard to balance. the heely effect are to dangerous for adults.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Godwin

customer_reviews.title: terrible stuff
customer_reviews.text: do not buy, it doesnt even work for first time after i fully charge it, and i have to pay for the shipping fee for return. and the seller try to slander me to broke their product??!
customer_reviews.author: bifl

customer_reviews.title: Hard to maneuver.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how a young child could safely use these when it was hard for an older person. Balancing on these was difficult since weight had to be shifted to the heels of both feet. My suggestion would be to have them like regular skates with 4 wheels that someone could put their whole foot into.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Schulte

customer_reviews.title: Son loves them
customer_reviews.text: took a bit ofpractice but my son age 11 loves them
customer_reviews.author: Momma of 6

customer_reviews.title: Very bulky hard to fit shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are very bulky and hard to ride my eight-year-old son wears a size 5 1/2 in boys and he had a very hard time fitting any shoe into this and most of the time tried to wear them barefoot which was a horrible idea he eventually just stopped playing with them and threw them in the closet
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure why these recieved such a bad review
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying them given the 3 star review these got but after reading why they were given, I thought I'd buy them and give them a try. I personally didnt find them that hard to ride, by the time I rode the 3rd time, I got the hang of them. They feel kinda heavy and not flimsy at all so I think they'll last. The one con tho is that the battery runs out VERY fast
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I loved it, or was soo fun. I got it for my 12th birthday, and it’s a perfect gift. Worth the price, it took a bit of time to get use to,but it was really fun. Videos of people telling you how to ride it for the first time was helpful. Now I’m a pro.😀❤️
customer_reviews.author: Nuh A.

customer_reviews.title: My inner child got the best of me.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone is curious, I’m 24 and squeezed my size 11 boot in it. And yes, it worked. Totally worth it 😂😂
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: SUPER FUN
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the money, super fun for kids young and old! You have to get used to it, but after a few hours my husband and son were cruising along!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon W

customer_reviews.title: 194lbs and i ride them regularly
customer_reviews.text: i weigh 194lbs and use them! my son has a vero vega and i can keep up with him on them. the battery only last 15mins for me but i am an adult that weighs way over the stated wieght limit.
customer_reviews.author: William Ennis

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: Not as we expected. Does not roll as smooth on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: hassan ali

customer_reviews.title: Unusable  and bad
customer_reviews.text: What is stupid item kids can’t enjoy it They are awesome riders on their skates that are non-motorized Thought I would be able to buy this for them however it has been a complete disaster
customer_reviews.author: Playful father

customer_reviews.title: Defective skates
customer_reviews.text: They were defective, didn't work so I shipped them back... disappointed...this was a Christmas gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.author: simone

customer_reviews.title: It is well made and safe.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it, but he has a talent for grasping a skill fast. He mastered right away.
customer_reviews.author: K-Chika

customer_reviews.title: Wicked fun!
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve never tried inline style skating(like myself) there’s a bit of a learning curve. I’m still not very good . But they are fun. I’m a 130 lb 30 M btw
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: My 13 year old really loves them. He thought they were so cool when he opened them on Christmas and he had never seen anything like them before
customer_reviews.author: Jacquie

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: They're very awkward. Not easy to control. Terrible on balancing.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Diamondz

customer_reviews.title: It takes practice to stand up in these . Lots of practice is needed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my nephew for Christmas. He loves them and uses them often.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The discription said it fixs the size 12US but my shoe is just 11 but i can't even put my shoe in.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Wheels don’t light.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the wheels don’t light up like the blue version
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Not for the overly cautious mom
customer_reviews.text: The boy loves them. They will suck up space next to the assigned outlet needed to charge them.
customer_reviews.author: anita

customer_reviews.title: Narrow feet = fun time
customer_reviews.text: These things are fun. But they do go fast do wear protection your first few outings. however YOU MUST HAVE NARROW SHOES if you are an adult. I don’t and tried them with just socks... not enough but what time my feet endured was great. These are meant for children not adults but if you can make it work more power to ya
customer_reviews.author: God of Rage

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for your business
customer_reviews.text: I work in the Emergency Department and this is where I first heard about these advanced Heelies. They have kept us busy with coccyx fractures, wrist fractures, and lacerations on otherwise dull, boring days. Products like these will always keep us in business. We would like the personally thank Razor for the business. Only downside is that they do not come in a size 14 shoe, otherwise I'd say 5 stars -Longshot
customer_reviews.author: Longshot

customer_reviews.title: Just by looking at this for a moment I can tell it is going to cause a lot of pain
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of just the page and information found there. I see a lot of kids getting hurt wearing these. My daughter wants these so bad but I can't see paying for ending up in the emergency room. I'll give these a 2 out of 5, for the sale page and info alone. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Grim

customer_reviews.title: Haven’t tried them yet...
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these from Walmart for my 8 yr old daughter who is a pro on the neon shoe wheels that do not have a motor. I’m wondering if these will be comparable as far as difficulty balancing on them... she’ll get them tomorrow at her birthday party so I’ll try to do an update.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: So I tried riding it to see if it would work for my bigger feet but nope~~do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I would give this product a zero if I could. I never write reviews but i had to warn others. It's poorly made, clunky and impossible to stay upright. My husband bought it for my son and we couldn't even get it to move. my son tried to ride but it was too big and bulky. So I tried riding it to see if it would work for my bigger feet but nope~~do not waste your money. Surprised that this actually made it to merchandise phase. My son was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Razor Turbo Jetts Electric Heel Wheels - Red
product_meta.description: Hit new heights of fun with the all-new Turbo Jetts electric motorized heel wheels! Simply start rolling and these electric-powered heel wheels amp up the action with an 80-watt, geared-drive motor to provide a one-of-a-kind boost to any pair of sneakers. Remoteless, the Turbo Jetts use an integrated, pressure-sensitive, power control system to help you ride comfortably at speeds up to 10 mph (16 km/h) for up to 30 minutes of continuous use. Simply step into the heavy-duty polymer "quick click" frame and tighten the hook-and-loop strap for a secure fit for sneakers U.S. size youth 12 to adult 12 (European youth 42 through adult 45). Recommended for ages 9 and older and will support a rider up to 176 pounds. The buyer and rider of all Razor products are responsible for knowing and obeying all local, state and federal regulations regarding the riding and use of all Razor products.
feature_bullets: 80-watt, geared-drive motor delivers smooth, steady power, allowing riders to control the action with their preferred foot
Powered by a 12-volt, lithium-ion battery that delivers an electrifying ride
Heavy-duty polymer "quick click" frame and tighten the hook-and-loop strap for a secure fit for sneakers U.S. Size youth 12 to adult 12
Recommended for ages 9 and up; supports riders up to 176 pounds
Keep the fun rolling at speeds up to 10 mph (16 km/H) for up to 30 minutes of continuous use. Wheels - Proprietary, LED lighted, 50 mm urethane with sealed bearings
